channel.title: Security Features on Aspose.Cells Product Family
channel.description: Recent content in Security Features on Aspose.Cells Product Family

item.title: Protecting Worksheets
item.description: When a worksheet is protected, the actions a user can take are restricted. For example, they cannot input data, insert or delete rows or columns etc. Contents Summary 1 Protect Worksheets 1.1 Introduction 1.2 Protect a Worksheet 1.3 Protect a few Cells in the Worksheet Using Microsoft Excel 1.4 Protect a few Cells in the Worksheet Using Aspose Cells 1.5 Protect a Row in the Worksheet 1.6 Protect a Column in the Worksheet

item.title: Unprotect a Worksheet
item.description: If a developer needs to remove protection from a protected worksheet at runtime so that some changes can be made to the file? This can easily be done with Aspose.Cells. Contents Summary 1 Unprotect a Worksheet 1.1 Using Microsoft Excel 1.2 Unprotecting a Simply Protected Worksheet Using Aspose.Cells 1.3 Unprotecting a Password Protected Worksheet Using Aspose.Cells | Unprotect a Worksheet Using Microsoft Excel

item.title: Advanced Protection Settings since Excel XP
item.description: Since the release of Excel 2002 or XP, Microsoft has added many advanced protection settings. Contents Summary 1 Introduction 1.1 Advanced Protection Settings Using Excel XP and Later Versions 1.2 Advanced Protection Settings Using Aspose.Cells 1.3 Cell Locking Issue || Introduction These protection settings restrict or allow users to: Delete rows or columns. Edit contents, objects or scenarios.

item.title: Specify Author while Write Protecting Workbook
item.description: Contents Summary 1 Possible Usage Scenarios 2 Specify Author while Write Protecting Workbook 3 Sample Code | Possible Usage Scenarios You can specify author name while write protecting your workbook using Aspose.Cells API. Please use Workbook.Settings.WriteProtection.Author property for this purpose. Specify Author while Write Protecting Workbook The following sample code explains the usage of Workbook.Settings.WriteProtection.Author property. The code creates an empty workbook, write protects it with a password, specifies the author name and saves it as output Excel file.
